data.title: Mister Rogers' Neighborhood
data.meta_description: Watch full-length Mister Rogers' Neighborhood programs. New episodes will be rotated in twice a month.
data.text:
Mister Rogers demonstrates the sounds of different bells. He also shows how a crystal glass rings and how the sound can be varied with different water levels in the glass.In the Neighborhood of Make-Believe, King Friday XIII and Queen Sara go to see Joey Hollingsworth tap dance. They get a bell for Henrietta for babysitting Prince Tuesday. Joey and Henrietta ring her new bell. X yells at them for ringing the bell. X is unhappy because he wants a job like Henrietta’s babysitting job. Back with Mister Rogers, he talks about X feeling angry because Henrietta got something he didn’t.

Mister Rogers explains how a projector works. He makes shadow figures on the screen. The Southminister Bell Ringers perform at Joe Negri’s shop.In the Neighborhood of Make-Believe, Henrietta rings her bell while Joey Hollingsworth dances. X comes out to see what is happening. He complains that Henrietta’s bell is disturbing the whole neighborhood. X visits Corney, Queen Sara, Lady Aberlin, and Elsie Jean, trying to convince them that Henrietta’s bell is a nuisance, as well as the cause of Ana’s and Prince Tuesday’s crying. No one agrees with him. Lady Aberlin asks X why he is upset about the bell. X won’t agree that he is upset. Mister Rogers talks about how X has been projecting his feelings.

Mister Rogers brings an oatmeal box with a button in it. After making a musical instrument out of the box, the button, and some string, he plays the piano and discusses anger.In the Neighborhood of Make-Believe, Lady Aberlin and Henrietta Pussycat talk about X’s attempt to convince King Friday to make a rule that there be no more bells in the Neighborhood of Make-Believe. Lady Aberlin and Henrietta discover that Henrietta’s bell is missing. X lies and says he didn’t take it. Then he pretends to find the bell and return it to Henrietta. Lady Aberlin suggests that X ask the king for a special job. Mister Rogers takes his oatmeal box and string outside and swings it around. Mrs. McFeely tries to play the oatmeal box instrument Mister Rogers made.

Mister Rogers shows what calling cards are.In the Neighborhood of Make-Believe, X waits for King Friday. King Friday makes X wait while Salesman Bogut interrupts. The king sends the salesman into the castle to wait. So X gets a chance to ask for a job. The king makes X the printer of royal calling cards. X hurries to finish the cards which are turning out messy. X decides to take his time. This time the cards turn out well. X takes the nice cards to the king. The king loves the cards. Mister Rogers goes to Betty Aberlin’s Little Theatre to watch pantomime artists perform.

Mister Rogers designates today a day to relax and do things that need to be done. He discovers his sink is clogged and attempts to fix it with a plunger. Since his plunger does not help he calls Mr. Horne, the plumber. Mister Rogers talks about how a child is too big to go down a drain. Mr. Horn fixes the drain. Audrey and Mister Rogers talk about the names of things like the elbow of a drain and the face of a clock. Audrey cleans up the spilled water.In the Neighborhood of Make-Believe, King Friday’s pipes are leaking at the castle. Handyman Negri holds the pipes so that they won’t drip on the castle, but he is tired and wants the king to get a plumber. The king sends for Mr. Horn, the plumber, who suggests the king have a recirculating waterfall installed. Handyman Negri and Mr. Horne install the new waterfall. Mister Rogers explains the difference between circulating water and water that travels through the pipes in a sink. Mrs. McFeely brings over a fountain.
